title: How to Make Strawberries and Cream

steps.headline: Select fresh, ripe strawberries.
steps.description: Choose 2 cups (400 g) of the freshest strawberries you can find, at the peak of their ripeness. They should be ruby red and firm, with bright green tops. Strawberries and cream is a pared-down version of strawberry flavor at its best, so making strawberries and cream with frozen or soft strawberries just won't do.

steps.headline: Wash the strawberries in a colander.
steps.description: Place them in a colander and rinse them gently with water, taking care to clean them on all sides. Don't handle the strawberries too roughly or you may bruise them.

steps.headline: Cut the strawberries into quarters with a paring knife.
steps.description: Begin by cutting off the green leafy tops with a paring knife. Do your best to not cut off too much of the strawberries’ flesh. Then, cut the strawberries in half lengthwise. From there, slice the halves in half to make quarters. Strawberries and cream is classically prepared with strawberries cut into halves or quarters, but you may cut them according to your personal preference. For example, small, bite-sized strawberry pieces might be easier for young children to eat.

steps.headline: Mix white sugar with the strawberries and let it sit for 30 minutes.
steps.description: Stir in 1 tbsp (12.5 g) of white granulated sugar until the strawberries are coated in the sugar. Then, set the strawberries aside for about 30 minutes to allow them to release their juices.

steps.headline: Put a bowl and electric mixer beaters in the freezer for 15 minutes.
steps.description: Place the beaters inside the bowl. Putting them in the freezer will chill them. Remove the bowl and beaters from the freezer after about 15 minutes. Chilling the bowl and beaters is important because the fat molecules in the cream expand quicker when they are cold.

steps.headline: Add heavy whipping cream and beat at high speed for 1-2 minutes.
steps.description: Pour the heavy whipping cream into your bowl and attach your beaters to your hand mixer. Start mixing at a low speed, and gradually increase your mixer to high speed. Mix the cream for 1-2 minutes, or until the cream has thickened.

steps.headline: Beat in powdered sugar and vanilla extract for 2-3 minutes.
steps.description: Add in 2/3 cup (70 g) of powdered sugar and 1  tsp (4.9 mL) of vanilla extract (if desired) to the heavy cream. Then, resume mixing, again starting on a low speed and eventually increasing to high speed. Beat the whipped cream at high speed until stiff peaks form, which usually takes around 2-3 minutes of beating. If you’re not ready to use your whipped cream just yet, you can store it in a covered bowl in your refrigerator for 1-2 days.

steps.headline: Combine the strawberries with the whipped cream.
steps.description: Dump the strawberries into the bowl with the cream and gently stir with a large spoon until the strawberries are coated in whipped cream. Don’t stir too vigorously — try to just gently fold in the strawberries.

steps.headline: Divide into glasses and garnish with a whole strawberry.
steps.description: You should have enough strawberries and cream for 4-6 servings, with each person receiving about a 1/2 cup (100 g) of strawberries. Place a whole strawberry on top of each serving to garnish and enjoy!

steps.headline: Wash and cut 16 strawberries.
steps.description:
Carefully rinse the strawberries in a colander to wash away any debris. Then, cut them to prepare them for the mascarpone cream. There are 2 ways you can cut them:
Perpendicular cuts: Use a paring knife to trim off the stem end to create a flat surface, and then place the stem end facing down on a cutting board. Next, cut the berry in half starting from the top, slicing down towards the cutting board but not all the way through the berry. Then, make another perpendicular slice using the same technique. Fan out the berry so it resembles a blooming flower. Upright, core removed: Alternatively, slice off the tip of the non-stem end so the berry can stand upright. Then, slice off the leafy stem and remove the core, so the inside of the berry is somewhat hollowed-out. Stand the berries upright.

steps.headline: Beat together Mascarpone, cream, sugar, and vanilla until it’s smooth.
steps.description: Use a hand mixer to beat together 1/2 cup (60 g) of Mascarpone cheese, ⁄4  c (59 mL) of heavy whipping cream, 2 tbsp (15 g) of sugar, and 1  tsp (4.9 mL) of vanilla extract in a large bowl. Mix it until it looks thick, but still smooth. You can also beat in the zest of one lemon to add a citrus flavor to the cream!

steps.headline: Pipe the filling into the strawberries.
steps.description: Put the filling in a piping bag with an attached star tip, or just a plastic sandwich bag with a corner cut off. Then, with the strawberries sitting upright, squeeze the filling onto the middle of the strawberries until they are completely full. The filling may slightly protrude from the top of the strawberries — this is okay!

steps.headline: Garnish with mint sprigs or toasted almonds.
steps.description: Finally, add a garnish of your choice if you’d like. Small sprigs of mint can add a fresh taste, or toasted almonds can bring a crunchy contrast to the sweetness of the cream.

methods.name: Making the Strawberries and Orange Cream

steps.headline: Wash and cut the strawberries into quarters.
steps.description: Place them in a colander and rinse them carefully. Use a paring knife to slice off the green tops. Slice the strawberries in half lengthwise, then cut them into quarters.

steps.headline: Juice and zest the oranges and lemons.
steps.description: Wash the oranges and lemons carefully, then dry them off. Use a zester (or in a pinch, a cheese grater) to scrape off the top layer of peel, the zest, into a bowl. Continue until the zest has been scraped away, then half the orange and lemon and squeeze out their juices.

steps.headline: Toss the strawberries with zest, juices, and sugar.
steps.description: Add the 1/2 cup (50 g) of powdered sugar, the zest and juice of 1 orange, and the zest and juice of 1 lemon to a bowl with the strawberries. Toss the ingredients with a spoon so the strawberries get completely coated.

steps.headline: Marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
steps.description: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a lid and place it in the refrigerator to marinate for 30 minutes. This will allow the citrus flavors and sugar to seep into the strawberries, making for a perfect combination of tangy and sweet.

steps.headline: Beat together the whipping cream, vanilla, juice and zest.
steps.description: Place the 2  c (470 mL) of heavy whipping cream in a mixing bowl. Scrape out the seeds from the vanilla bean pod using a spoon and add them to the bowl. Then, mix in the remaining orange and lemon juice and zest. Beat the mixture using a handheld mixer until the cream thickens to form soft peaks. This is how you create the orange cream!

steps.headline: Place a scoop of orange sorbet and strawberries in each serving cup.
steps.description: Prepare each serving in an individual martini glass or small glass bowl. Make sure that you add a generous layer of marinated strawberries.

steps.headline: Finish with a dollop of orange cream and garnishes.
steps.description: Use a spoon to scoop orange cream onto each serving. Garnish with 1/8 cup (15 g) grated dark chocolate or 1/8 cup (20 g) chopped walnuts and enjoy!
